result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Andre Richard Stewart appeared by video. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi was just appointed and requests additional time. Atty Dolfi has received discovery and offer but has not discussed with DE. Court sets PSC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 09:45 AM

Set for Return on Warrant/Arraignment. Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson has no information. ADA Smestad requests stay be lifted on warrant. 08:37 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Andre Richard Stewart did not appear. Set for Arraignment Court reviews file. Atty Harrelson doesn't have any information regarding Defendant's whereabouts. Court will allow Atty Harrelson to attempt to call Defendant. Off record at 8:39 AM. Recalled at 8:42 AM. Appearances as previously stated. Atty Harrelson states DE didn't have transportation for today's hearing and overnighted a letter. ADA Smestad doesn't object to a stayed warrant. Court issues warrant and STAYS until 6/17/22 at 10AM IN PERSON. If Defendant appears at next hearing, Court will take up Arraignment at that time. Adjourned at 8:46 AM.  gll  Return on warrant scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

01:57 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Andre Richard Stewart appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Intern Dippolito Motions to dismiss Count 2. Court reserves on Motion. Court orders bond. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
